nodes.text: So how are things going for you?
I have been exploring some the more hidden areas of the castle recently. Have you found the Underground Corridor?
Where's that?
I'd normally charge for a secret like this, but we're such good friends that I'm willing to give it up for free.

options.text: Ask for Joel's Clue About the Underground Corridor

nodes.text: Thanks, I'd like to hear about it.
To get to the Underground Corridor, you need to go to the Dark Passage by way of the Hall of Heroes. If you turn the head on the bust, the entranceway will open.
Fomr the Underground Corridor, you can take the ladder up to the gazebo in the Courtyard.
It's a useful path to take when you wish to avoid Mr. Terk's observation.

options.text: Decline Joel's Clue About the Underground Corridor

nodes.text: No thanks, I'll figure it out for myself.
As you wish. But don't forget I offered.
I'll be happy to clue you into the secrets of how to find and use it... for a modest fee.

options.text: Buy a Clue About the Underground Corridor for Five Lyra

nodes.text: To get to the Underground Corridor, you can climb down from the trapdoor in the center of the Gazebo in the courtyard. The corridor leads to two doors, that, alas, cannot be opened from this side.
However, the staircase at the far end leads up to the Hidden Hallway. From the Hidden Hallway, you can take the concealed door back to our dorm hallway.
It's a useful path to take when you wish to avoid Mr. Terk's observation.

nodes.name: Underground Corridor
nodes.description: There's a trapdoor in the Gazebo that leads down to an Underground Corridor. Sounds like an exciting place to explore.

nodes.text: No thanks, I'll figure it out for myself.
Yeah, creepy place, isn't it?
Indeed. I suspect that the two barred doors in that area must first be opened from the other side.
Sadly, I have not yet found where they lead.
How are things going?
My day would be much better if you were perhaps to purchase one of my items for sale.

options.text: Ask About the Rope and Grapnel

nodes.text: What were you saying about the rope and grapnel?
I have a very fine rope and grapnel that has the "Good Housebreaking Steal of Approval". It's just what you need for life's little ups and downs, so to speak.
So what's this Houdini thingy you mentioned?
There are some locks deliberately designed to defy ordinary lock picking. For those, you will need to use the Houdini 42. It's an essential tool for advancing your lock picking skills.
Heard anything interesting recently?

It seems that Mr. Terk was most displeased when he learned that the school thief was not a Rogue. He implied that the thefts were some sort of plot staged by Master von Urwald to make Rogues look good.
Master von Urwald, needless to say, did not like having his honor impugned. It is a pity that I do not speak Germanish so that I could appreciate some of the Master's more graphic responses.
See ya.
Farewell.
